column4: So nobody can help me with my microphone settings problem, then.
Decard_BR26354: I've already been on the forums and didn't find a solution. That's why I came here. I can't give up because I don't have a phone and need my microphone to use VoIP.
If nobody is going to help me that's fine, I just won't waste more time sitting here asking. You guys are usually very helpful and I appreciate that, so if you can't help so be it.
usually on laptops there are two different mics -in my samsung it is- pop up the mixer window, and go to settings
you should see two mics, one is just mic, and the other one is front mic.
just switch them on and off until you hear some sound from it, that's the way I solved it.

I don't see anything that says front mic. In the default mixer window I just see Microphone, which is enabled and at full volume. Then when I go into Recording, there's a thing that says Microphone and it's disabled.
Whenever I enable it, it re-disables itself. The setting won't stick.
maybe you should switch off any voip software before trying to record
sometimes you can access sound hardware at one program only
